abstract.text: The uneditable content of a notification.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object contains the data associated with a notification. When your app receives a notification, the associated

object contains an object of this type with the content that your app received. Use the content object to get the details of the notification, including the type of notification that the system delivered, any custom data you stored in the
dictionary before scheduling the notification, and any attachments.

Don’t create instances of this class directly. For remote notifications, the system derives the contents of this object from the JSON payload that your server sends to the APNS server. For local notifications, create a
object, and configure the contents of that object instead.

UserNotifications-PageImage-card.png.alt: [A notification interface displayed on the lock screen of an iOS device.]

abstract.text: Push user-facing notifications to the user’s device from a server, or generate them locally from your app.
The editable content for a notification.
An icon associated with an action.
A media file associated with a notification.
The uneditable content of a notification.
The visual and audio attachments to display alongside the notification’s main content.
The number that your app’s icon displays.
The localized text that provides the notification’s main content.
The identifier of the notification’s category.
The criteria the system evaluates to determine if it displays the notification in the current Focus.
The notification’s importance and required delivery timing.
The name of the image or storyboard to use when your app launches because of the notification.
The score the system uses to determine if the notification is the summary’s featured notification.
The sound that plays when the system delivers the notification.
The localized text that provides the notification’s secondary description.
The text the system adds to the notification summary to provide additional context.
The number the system adds to the notification summary when the notification represents multiple items.
The value your app uses to determine which scene to display to handle the notification.
The identifier that groups related notifications.
The localized text that provides the notification’s primary description.
Returns a copy of the notification that includes content from the specified provider.
The custom data to associate with the notification.
A protocol the system uses to provide context relevant to user notifications.
Constants that indicate the importance and delivery timing of a notification.
A request to schedule a local notification, which includes the content of the notification and the trigger conditions for delivery.
The sound played upon delivery of a notification.
A string providing the name of a sound file.
Send notifications to the user’s device with a JSON payload.
Configure and display your app’s communication notifications by using intents.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
A protocol that mutable objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
